title: Hold up, spellshields don't work on Zenith Blade?
body:
So poor communication led to my Ori being banned, and I pick Morgana thinking she'll be a good counter to the Leona/Ashe across the lane.
But then I discover that Leona gets the in even when I shield the hook.
What the hell?
Research reveals this has been the way it works for YEARS.
With most skills it's as if the spell never landed but apparently hook spells that _move the caster_ still do so even though they "didn't land".
This makes no sense. Spellshield should block ALL hooks, not just the ones that don't move the caster.

replies.body: It prevents the root of Zenith Blade and the damage from it.

Morgana makes Leona unplayable.
Black shield doesnt "block" Zenith Blade, but it absorbs the damage, the sunlight tag, the root, and it makes it so she cant stun you with her Q either.
So while she does "get the in" as you say, she cant actually do anything with it, because she cant stun you, root you, or tag you with sunlight.
Ultimately all that happens is she goes in, does nothing, and takes alot of damage in the process.

It is mandatory to ban Morgana if youre going to play Leona.

It's mandatory to ban morgana if you aren't first pick and intending to play her. *

Spellshields only block the behaviors of hooks that affect the shielded target. They do NOT prevent effects that the caster of the hook from using moving mechanics of their own.

If Blitz hooks a spellshield, the damage will come out of the shield, but the target won't be pulled.
If Pyke hooks a spellshield, the damage will bypass the shield, and the target won't be pulled (AD damage)
If Thresh hooks a spellshield, the damage will come out of the shield, the spell shielded target will not move, BUT Thresh will still be able to double tap Q to bring himself to the target.
If Leona hooks a spellshield, the damage will come out of the shield, but the root will be negated, and Leona will move to the target.

You misconception is that you viewed hitting a spellshield as a "Miss." It's not a miss. It's a hit that prevents some damage, and prevents CC.

Spell shield also doesn't block Marks, which are not CC.

Spellshields block cc and magic damage. All you do is block those two things, **she dashes to the target regardless if the damage applies or not**. Thresh hook functions the same (aka he can recast it). All you have to do in that situation vs leo is just bind her as she's Eing in, shes always going to be on a linear trajectory.
And already be walking back from where you were.... Leona can still Q otherwise.

For more: it negates the root, but not the subsequent headshot of Cait traps. It prevents Naut from pulling *you* but he will still move slightly toward you. It will block Thresh hook cc, but he can still pull to you. And it will not block Pyke ult, since it's an AD execute.

On a good note: it actually does make you immune to the pull that is Urgot's execute, since that's technically a cc. So...if he lands the R but doesn't pull in time, you *can* cockblock man-crabs.

So, the spell works 100% as intended.

Negating CC and blocking magic damage.
Were you suggesting im an idiot and dont know that, or were you just saying what i already said...

You are 100% correct on everything you said. I just wanted to emphasise that everything you said not only is _how it works_ , but also it is _how it is supposed to work_ .
 Cheers. Didn't mean any sarcasm or suggest anything demeaning towards you. Sorry if it came out that way.
Spellshield only prevents abilities from damaging/CCing you, it wont just delete the ability from existence.

Nah but seriously though: spellshields not blocking the entire spell breaks the expectation. Every other spell has no effect when blocked, Zenith Blade/Dredge Line shouldn't either. Riot has already shown that they're willing to fix things that break the players' expectations, they should fix this too.

> Nah but seriously though: spellshields not blocking the entire spell breaks the expectation. Every other spell has no effect when blocked, Zenith Blade/Dredge Line shouldn't either


What a load of bollocks. Are you mental? You think jax Q on spelshielded enemy DOESNT JUMP? It doesn't break expectations, it works ENTIRELY as you expect if you know what the spell does and what the enemy's spell does.

Do you think any targeted point click dash/blink doesn't work on blackshielded targets? If so, it's a bug that should be fixed, but I doubt there is a single spell like that.


Morgana E is CC and MAGIC DAMAGE immunity. It says so in the freaking tooltip. It does exactly what it says it does.

> Do you think any targeted point click dash/blink doesn't work on blackshielded targets? If so, it's a bug that should be fixed, but I doubt there is a single spell like that.

Jax's leap is not comparable because it's_ not a spell Jax is casting on the enemy_. Yes, in the real world, a summoner is targeting the enemy champion and pressing a button. But **in-universe** Jax is not casting a spell at his enemy.
A spell shield in-universe should block spells and abilities cast on the champion in-universe.
In-universe summoners are not a thing, and whether or not a spell is targeted has no bearing on whether or not, **in-universe**, it's a spell or ability hitting the shielded champion.

You seem to be in denial about what morgana E is.

Morgana E is a shield that negates CC and blocks magic damage, _as stated in the ability's tooltip_ . Nothing more nothing less. I don't see where your confusion comes from. 

Also, your entire "universe" logic makes no sense. It's the same logic as saying "in universe tristana W is  a jump so it should go over traps without triggering them" .

Jax Q is a spell. End of story. It counts as a spell for everything.


By your logic, brand should do no damage to water based champs and do more vs ice champions.. Cause *in universe* it's a fireball hitting water/ice

> [{quoted}](name=Saezio,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=usO9GioX,comment-id=00030000000100000000,timestamp=2020-01-14T16:43:42.886+0000)
> Morgana E is a shield that negates CC and blocks magic damage, _as stated in the ability's tooltip_ . Nothing more nothing less. I don't see where your confusion comes from. 

The only confusion here is you confusing code for canon.

The **code** is "negates CC and magic damage". The **canon** is that spell shields are magic shields that either absorb or deflect spells. In either case the spell is prevented from reaching its target, which means it should have the same effect as a spell that gets thrown into Aurelion Sol's domain by Windwall. None.

> Also, your entire "universe" logic makes no sense. It's the same logic as saying "in universe tristana W is  a jump so it should go over traps without triggering them" .

Sure, in a world where "straightforward" means the same thing as "nonsensical".
Tristana's jump should absolutely evade bear traps. Because "high in the air" is inconsistent with "oops I stepped on a trap". It wouldn't even effect game balance much. How you can understand something so perfectly and also claim it doesn't make sense is beyond my reckoning.

> Jax Q is a spell. End of story. It counts as a spell for everything.

No, it isn't. It might be coded as one, but AGAIN, code is not canon. In canon, it's a jump.

> By your logic, brand should do no damage to water based champs and do more vs ice champions.. Cause *in universe* it's a fireball hitting water/ice

If being logically consistent on that matter wouldn't _completely break the game balance_, yes. Not completely adding a whole 'nother dimension to the game's balance and thus making the balance team's work 1000% harder is a pretty good argument for not fixing a logical inconsistency.

You don't get rooted from the E of leona. THAT's the CC part, THAT's what you dodge. Same with vi Ult, she still comes to you, you just don't get CCd. Thresh IIRC can still recast his Q on spellshielded target too. Black shield is CC immunity and magic damage shield, that's all. Why on earth did you think it cancels the enemy's movement spells? xD

You also want morg E to make enemy's movement spells disabled? that wouldn't be op at all. xD
Amumu, Nautilus, and Thresh will also pull themselves.

Believe me us Leona players WISH that Black shield would prevent Zenith Blade from dashing.
Because all it does is get us killed since our kit cant connect to black shield when its up and now we're balls deep with our whole kit on CD, and we cant do anything but sit in your root.
Spell shields will prevent the CC but not the dash if the spell shielded target is the last champion hit by it.
